text: The Coalition Against the Marcos Dictatorship was a group based in North America that fought against the rule of Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos during the 1970s. In February 1986, after the People Power Revolution ended the corrupt Marcos regime, CAMD changed its name to the Committee to Advance the Movement for Democracy and Independence (CAMDI). ==References== Category:Politics of the Philippines
title: Coalition Against the Marcos Dictatorship
